content.body: TabAtkins: annevk : this seems like a case for link-defaults, just on a larger scale? Like maybe all WHATWG specs get link-defaults for all HTML elements? Or maybe "all web specs", if we can operationalize that? Or even all Bikeshed specs, so that epub-related specs are the ones that need to override the link defaults? (But I'm not sure how such epub-related specs would necessarily find that out...)
content.formatted_body: TabAtkins: annevk : this seems like a case for link-defaults, just on a larger scale? Like maybe all WHATWG specs get link-defaults for all HTML elements? Or maybe "all web specs", if we can operationalize that? Or even all Bikeshed specs, so that epub-related specs are the ones that need to override the link defaults? (But I'm not sure how such epub-related specs would necessarily find that out...)

content.body: Yeah, I'm gonna have to figure something out. The big global namespace works *adequately* for W3C specs, but as more come online these sort of conflicts will happen more often.
content.formatted_body: Yeah, I'm gonna have to figure something out. The big global namespace works adequately for W3C specs, but as more come online these sort of conflicts will happen more often.

content.body: FYI, I'm on vacation until nearly the end of the month.

content.body: And we did revamp open() to be a giant document state reset. Perhaps that was really the case that kept the weird Window : Document 1:2 relationship alive?
Want to save that to a clickable link?
I'm still a little confused on the relationship between load events and 1:2 Window:Documents...
E.g. same-origin.html in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/804797 doesn't use load events at all and I think it's testing window object reuse.
* E.g. same-origin-initial.html in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/804797 doesn't use load events at all and I think it's testing window object reuse.

m.new_content.body: E.g. same-origin-initial.html in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/804797 doesn't use load events at all and I think it's testing window object reuse.

content.body: Ah yeah it does. And if you set `.src` after connection it does take effect. I do see replacement then. https://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/saved/13652
